title: ICE in constructor with nested array copy constructor

milestone.title: Basic const generics and missing features

body:
### Code see https://godbolt.org/z/7cv5q55nY ```rust const BLOCK_LEN: usize = 64; const IV: [u32; 8] = [ 0x6A09E667, 0xBB67AE85, 0x3C6EF372, 0xA54FF53A, 0x510E527F, 0x9B05688C, 0x1F83D9AB, 0x5BE0CD19, ]; struct ChunkState { chaining_value: [u32; 8], chunk_counter: u64, block: [u8; BLOCK_LEN], block_len: u8, blocks_compressed: u8, flags: u32, } impl ChunkState { fn new(key_words: [u32; 8], chunk_counter: u64, flags: u32) -> Self { Self { chaining_value: key_words, chunk_counter, block: [0; BLOCK_LEN], block_len: 0, blocks_compressed: 0, flags, } } } pub struct Hasher { chunk_state: ChunkState, key_words: [u32; 8], cv_stack: [[u32; 8]; 54], // Space for 54 subtree chaining values: cv_stack_len: u8, // 2^54 * CHUNK_LEN = 2^64 flags: u32, } impl Hasher { fn new_internal(key_words: [u32; 8], flags: u32) -> Self { Self { chunk_state: ChunkState::new(key_words, 0, flags), key_words, cv_stack: [[0; 8]; 54], cv_stack_len: 0, flags, } } /// Construct a new `Hasher` for the regular hash function. pub fn new() -> Self { Self::new_internal(IV, 0) } } ``` see the gimple: ``` __attribute__((cdecl)) struct example::ChunkState example::ChunkState::new (const u32[8] key_words, const u64 chunk_counter, const u32 flags) { struct example::ChunkState RUSTTMP.0; return {.chaining_value=VIEW_CONVERT_EXPR(key_words), .chunk_counter=(u64) chunk_counter, .block=VIEW_CONVERT_EXPR({ u8 RUSTTMP.1[64]; u64 RUSTTMP.2 = (u64) example::BLOCK_LEN; u8 * RUSTTMP.3 = &RUSTTMP.1[0]; while (1) { if (RUSTTMP.2 == 0) break; *RUSTTMP.3 = 0; RUSTTMP.3++ ; RUSTTMP.2-- ; } }, RUSTTMP.1), .block_len=0, .blocks_compressed=0, .flags=(u32) flags}; } __attribute__((cdecl)) struct example::Hasher example::Hasher::new_internal (const u32[8] key_words, const u32 flags) { struct example::Hasher RUSTTMP.4; return {.chunk_state=example::ChunkState::new (key_words, 0, flags), .key_words=VIEW_CONVERT_EXPR(key_words), .cv_stack=VIEW_CONVERT_EXPR({ u32 RUSTTMP.8[54][8]; u64 RUSTTMP.9 = 54; u32[8] * RUSTTMP.10 = &RUSTTMP.8[0]; while (1) { if (RUSTTMP.9 == 0) break; *RUSTTMP.10 = VIEW_CONVERT_EXPR({ u32 RUSTTMP.5[8]; u64 RUSTTMP.6 = 8; u32 * RUSTTMP.7 = &RUSTTMP.5[0]; while (1) { if (RUSTTMP.6 == 0) break; *RUSTTMP.7 = 0; RUSTTMP.7++ ; RUSTTMP.6-- ; } }, RUSTTMP.5); RUSTTMP.10++ ; RUSTTMP.9-- ; } }, RUSTTMP.8), .cv_stack_len=0, .flags=(u32) flags}; } __attribute__((cdecl)) struct example::Hasher example::Hasher::new () { struct example::Hasher RUSTTMP.11; return example::Hasher::new_internal (example::IV, 0); } ``` ### Meta - What version of Rust GCC were you using, git sha if possible. 8809ee8c6a5621e830f3cfe66c381f986e63c7f2 ### Error output ``` :49:9: internal compiler error: 'verify_gimple' failed ```
Backtrace

``` : In function 'example::Hasher::new': :49:9: error: invalid conversion in gimple call struct example::Hasher struct example::Hasher = example::Hasher::new_internal (example::IV, 0); [return slot optimization] :49:9: internal compiler error: 'verify_gimple' failed 0x216c8ee internal_error(char const*, ...) ???:0 0x1276fb5 verify_gimple_in_seq(gimple*) ???:0 0xf3b136 gimplify_body(tree_node*, bool) ???:0 0xf3b2d1 gimplify_function_tree(tree_node*) ???:0 0xd759d7 cgraph_node::analyze() ???:0 0xd794c1 symbol_table::finalize_compilation_unit() ???:0 Please submit a full bug report, with preprocessed source if appropriate. Please include the complete backtrace with any bug report. See for instructions. Compiler returned: 1 ```
